perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 60 days' written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 90 days' written notice by Integrity.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 15 days' written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 30 days' written notice by Integrity.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination notice periods for both the Fund and Integrity creates a conflict with the Investment Company Act of 1940 which requires reasonable termination notice. 15 or 30 days may be deemed unreasonable.
perturbation.law_explanation: Section 15(a)(4) of the Investment Company Act of 1940 requires that investment advisory contracts provide for termination upon no more than 60 days' written notice. While this applies directly to advisory contracts, similar standards of reasonableness apply to fund distribution agreements, and reducing the Fund's termination notice to 15 days and Integrity's to 30 days may be deemed an unreasonably short period, potentially hindering the fund's ability to find a replacement distributor.

perturbation.original_text: The Fund's agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers and governors, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon the Fund's being notified of any action brought against Integrity, its officers or governors, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or by telegram addressed to the Fund at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to the Fund by the person against whom such action is brought, within ten days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.changed_text: The Fund's agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers and governors, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon the Fund's being notified of any action brought against Integrity, its officers or governors, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or by telegram addressed to the Fund at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to the Fund by the person against whom such action is brought, within two days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period for indemnification claims to two days may be insufficient and unreasonable, potentially violating due process principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment
perturbation.law_explanation: The Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment requires fair notice and an opportunity to be heard. While this clause primarily applies to government actions, contractual provisions that impose unreasonably short deadlines for critical actions like providing notice of a lawsuit may be challenged as violating fundamental fairness principles, especially if it prejudices the indemnifying party's ability to adequately defend itself.

perturbation.original_text: The Fund shall not file any amendment to any registration statement or supplement to any prospectus or statement of additional information without giving Integrity reasonable notice thereof in advance; provided, however, that nothing contained in this Agreement shall in any way limit the Fund's right to file at any time such amendments to any registration statement and/or supplements to any prospectus or statement of additional information, of whatever character, as the Fund may deem advisable, such right being in all respects absolute and unconditional.
perturbation.changed_text: The Fund shall not file any amendment to any registration statement or supplement to any prospectus or statement of additional information without giving Integrity one hour's notice thereof in advance; provided, however, that nothing contained in this Agreement shall in any way limit the Fund's right to file at any time such amendments to any registration statement and/or supplements to any prospectus or statement of additional information, of whatever character, as the Fund may deem advisable, such right being in all respects absolute and unconditional.
perturbation.explanation: Providing only one hour's notice before filing amendments to registration statements could be deemed unreasonable and a breach of the duty of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: While Kansas law (specified in Section 8.3 of the agreement) recognizes the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing in contracts, one hour's notice could be considered an unreasonable timeframe and a bad faith action, effectively nullifying Integrity's ability to review or respond to the amendments, thereby frustrating the purpose of the agreement.
